intro: Conostylis dielsii subsp. teres, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale green flowers. This subspecies is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
